title: Create an enterprise asset
content:
Perform the following steps to create an enterprise asset.

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Enterprise Assets.

  3. Click New.

  4. In the New Enterprise Asset dialog box, provide all requested information. This dialog requests values for the basic enterprise asset attributes.

    Field Description
    Display label A meaningful name that describes the enterprise asset.
    Subtype Mandatory. A level of categorization.
    Process type Mandatory. Type of the enterprise asset process, including Full Ownership, Consumable, and Stationary.

    If a batch model is entered in the Model field, the process type is Consumable and can't be edited.
    Model The definitive model to which the enterprise asset belongs.
    Owner The person who manages the enterprise asset.
    Asset tag Physical assets have physical tags attached with a unique identifier.
    Location Physical location of a physical asset.
    Batch

    Select this option to define this asset as managed collectively instead of individually.

    Available when: The process type is Consumable. If a batch model is entered in the Model field, the value of the Batch option is copied from the model and can't be edited.
    Quantity

    The number of individual assets that comprise this batch asset. The default value is 1.

    Available when: The Batch option is selected.
    UOM

    The unit of measure of the individual assets in batch assets. 

    Available when: The Batch option is selected. If a batch model is entered in the Model field, the UOM is copied from the model but can be edited.
    Serial number

    The manufacturer's assigned serial number or unique ID for a product or element.

    Available when: The Batch option isn't selected.
    Select phase The phase that the asset is currently in.

  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.
